title: How does the law affect you?
subtitle: Ages and Rights

reading.title: 1 Voting
reading.text: In most countries around the world, including Britain, you can vote from the age of eighteen. In some countries, like Argentina, you have to vote – if you don't, you can go to prison! The youngest voters in the world are in Iran. You can vote there from the age of fifteen. Some politicians in Britain want to change the voting age to sixteen, to involve young people more in politics.

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: New Zealand was the first country to give women the vote – in 1893.

reading.title: 2 Marriage
reading.text: In most of Europe, you are allowed to marry at eighteen (sixteen with your parents' permission). In China, couples need to be more patient – men can't marry before the age of twenty-two and women before twenty.

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: In Scotland, young people can marry at sixteen without their parents' permission. That's why, traditionally, young couples run away to Gretna Green (on the English/Scottish border) for 'quickie' weddings.

reading.title: 3 Military Service
reading.text: In many European countries, young men have to do military service, usually for between three and eighteen months. In Switzerland, men have to go back into the army every year for three weeks. In Britain, there is only a professional army. You can join the army from the age of sixteen.

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: If you drop out of high school in Egypt, you have to do four years military service instead!

reading.title: 4 Criminal responsibility
reading.text: In Britain, you become responsible for crimes you commit from the age of ten. Before that, the law says that you are too young to understand your actions, whether you spray graffiti on a wall, steal sweets or commit murder! In parts of the USA and Australia, this age is just six, while in most European countries, it is fifteen or sixteen.

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: Until recently, many US states used the death penalty for criminals under eighteen. Between 1990 and 2005, nineteen young people died in this way.

reading.title: 5 Smoking and drinking
reading.text: In the UK, it's illegal to buy alcohol until you are eighteen years old (although you're allowed to drink alcohol at home from the age of five!). In the USA, you're not allowed to buy alcohol until you're twenty-one and they are very strict about ID.

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: In most US states and in the UK, smoking is banned inside bars and nightclubs and you're not allowed to drink alcohol outside them!

reading.title: 6 Driving
reading.text: According to UK law, you are not allowed to drive until you are seventeen, while in most of Europe it is eighteen. In the USA, you can drive much younger, in some states from the age of just fourteen!

reading.title: FACT!
reading.text: Until 1935, you didn't have to take a driving test in the UK – you could just buy a car and drive away!

quiz.q: At what age can you vote in most countries?
quiz.fb: Correct! In most countries, you can vote from the age of eighteen.

quiz.q: Which country was the first to give women the vote?
quiz.fb: Correct! New Zealand was the first country to give women the vote in 1893.

quiz.q: In China, at what age can men get married?
quiz.fb: Correct! In China, men can't marry before the age of twenty-two.

quiz.q: Where can young couples go for 'quickie' weddings in the UK?
quiz.fb: Correct! Young couples traditionally run away to Gretna Green on the English/Scottish border.

quiz.q: How long do Swiss men have to go back into the army each year?
quiz.fb: Correct! In Switzerland, men have to go back into the army every year for three weeks.

quiz.q: At what age do you become responsible for crimes in Britain?
quiz.fb: Correct! In Britain, you become responsible for crimes from the age of ten.

quiz.q: What is the age of criminal responsibility in most European countries?
quiz.fb: Correct! In most European countries, the age of criminal responsibility is fifteen or sixteen.

quiz.q: At what age can you buy alcohol in the USA?
quiz.fb: Correct! In the USA, you're not allowed to buy alcohol until you're twenty-one.

quiz.q: From what age can you drink alcohol at home in the UK?
quiz.fb: Correct! In the UK, you're allowed to drink alcohol at home from the age of five!

quiz.q: At what age can you drive in the UK?
quiz.fb: Correct! According to UK law, you are not allowed to drive until you are seventeen.

quiz.q: In some US states, from what age can you drive?
quiz.fb: Correct! In some US states, you can drive from the age of just fourteen!

quiz.q: What does 'vote' mean?
opts: To choose a leader in an election
quiz.fb: Correct! 'Vote' means to choose a leader or make a choice in an election.

quiz.q: What does 'permission' mean?
quiz.fb: Correct! 'Permission' means official approval or consent to do something.

quiz.q: What does 'commit' mean in the phrase 'commit a crime'?
quiz.fb: Correct! 'Commit' means to do or carry out an action, especially a crime.

quiz.q: What does 'banned' mean?
quiz.fb: Correct! 'Banned' means officially prohibited or forbidden by law.

quiz.q: Choose the correct word: You can ____ in the election at 18.
quiz.fb: Correct! After 'can' we use the base form of the verb: 'vote'.

quiz.q: What is a 'politician'?
quiz.fb: Correct! A 'politician' is a person who is professionally involved in politics.

quiz.q: Complete: You are not ____ to drive until you are 17.
quiz.fb: Correct! We use 'allowed' in the passive structure 'be allowed to'.

quiz.q: Which sentence is correct?
opts: You have to do military service.
quiz.fb: Correct! After 'have to' we use the base form of the verb: 'do'.

quiz.q: Make a negative: You ____ buy alcohol at 16 in the UK.
quiz.fb: Correct! 'Can't' is used to express that something is not allowed or not possible.
